docs.text: Reference schema Classes Agent - person, group, organization or project that provides a piece of information (i.e. a knowledge association) Assembly AuthorReference Entity - Root Biolink Model class for all things and informational relationships, real or imagined. Association - A typed association between two entities, supported by evidence ReferenceToMeshAssociation CrossReference NamedThing - a databased entity or concept/class BiologicalEntity MolecularEntity - A gene, gene product, small molecule or macromolecule (including protein complex)" GenomicEntity - an entity that can either be directly located on a genome (gene, transcript, exon, regulatory region) or is encoded in a genome (protein) Allele Chromosome Gene - A region (or regions) that includes all of the sequence elements necessary to encode a functional transcript. A gene locus may include regulatory regions, transcribed regions and/or other functional sequence regions. Transcript - An RNA synthesized on a DNA or RNA template by an RNA polymerase. Ontology - a concept or class in an ontology, vocabulary or thesaurus GoTerm SoTerm Feature GenomicLocation Identifier InformationContentEntity - a piece of information that typically describes some topic of discourse or is used as support. Reference Note Species Synonym Mixins Slots abstract reference➞abstract - The abstract of the reference. alliance category reference➞alliance category - Controlled vocabulary term drawn from a list of Alliance-defined reference categories. association slot - any slot that relates an association to another entity negated - if set to true, then the association is negated i.e. is not true object - connects an association to the object of the association. For example, in a gene-to-phenotype association, the gene is subject and phenotype is object. reference to mesh association➞object - has topic is the relation used to describe the relationship between predicate - A high-level grouping for the relationship type. AKA minimal predicate. This is analogous to category for nodes. qualifiers - This is the MeSH qualifier term that is optionally added to the descriptor term. relation - The relation which describes an association between a subject and an object in a more granular manner. Usually this is a term from Relation Ontology, but it can be any edge CURIE. subject - connects an association to the subject of the association. For example, in a gene-to-phenotype association, the gene is subject and phenotype is object. reference to mesh association➞subject category association➞category citation reference➞citation - Is a reference to a source. data provider - MOD that provided data date_produced - date AGR data generated by MOD description - a human-readable description of an entity display name id - A unique identifier for a thing. Must be either a CURIE shorthand for a URI or a complete URI agent➞id - Different classes of agents have distinct preferred identifiers. For publishers, use the ISBN publisher code. See https://grp.isbn-international.org/ for publisher code lookups. For editors, authors and individual providers, use the individual's ORCID if available; Otherwise, a ScopusID, ResearchID or Google Scholar ID ('GSID') may be used if the author ORCID is unknown. Institutional agents could be identified by an International Standard Name Identifier ('ISNI') code. reference➞id - the identifier for the publication in the form of a curie. issue name mod last modified date - The date the meta data on this object was last updated at the MOD. reference➞mod last modified date name - a human-readable name for an entity agent➞name - it is recommended that an author's 'name' property be formatted as "surname, firstname initial." node property - A grouping for any property that holds between a node and a value address - the particulars of the place where someone or an organization is situated. For now, this slot is a simple text "blob" containing all relevant details of the given location for fitness of purpose. For the moment, this "address" can include other contact details such as email and phone number(?). corresponding author creation date - date on which an entity was created. This can be applied to nodes or edges information content entity➞creation date - Precedence of identifiers for references is as follows: PMID if available; DOI if not; actual alternate CURIE otherwise. date arrived in pubmed - Day in which a reference or resource was created in PUBMED. Only relevant for PUBMED references. reference➞date arrived in pubmed - As per the PUBMED XML record, this is the date the reference entered PUBMED. date last modified - Date on which an entity was last modified by the MOD. date last modified in pubmed - Date on which an entity was created. date published - Date on which an entity was created. reference➞date published - The date the reference was published. This field can be submitted by a MOD or from PUBMED. When pulled from PUBMED, this date is generated from the year, month and day published fields. When submitted from a MOD it can be any string. examples include: Spring 1991, 01-01-1991, 25-12-1991 day published - Day in which an entity was created. reference➞day published - When the reference is a PUBMED reference, this will be a 2-digit day. first name has authors reference➞has authors - List of authors in the reference. There might be more than one author in the publication with the same name. has biological sequence - connects a genomic feature to its sequence has cross references reference➞has cross references - The list of crossReference objects associated with a reference. has keywords - keywords tagging a publication has mod reference types - List of types as assigned at a MOD. reference➞has mod reference types - Reference type as defined by the MOD on submission of the publication. has tags - Optional ist of controlled vocabulary tags that give categories to each pub (ie: "can show images"). reference➞has tags - Tags from the MOD from a controlled vocabulary of possible tags. initials issue date - Date on which an entity was issued. last modified - Date on which an entity was last modified in PubMed or in the MOD. last name middle names month published - Month in which an entity was created. reference➞month published - When the reference is a PUBMED reference, this will be a 2-digit year. pages - page number of source referenced for statement or publication reference➞pages - Page number of source referenced for statement or publication pub med type - Type of information content entity as descriped by pub med/ symbol - Symbol for a particular thing year published - Year in which an entity was created. reference➞year published - When the reference is a PUBMED reference, this will be a 4-digit year. page areas prefix - Denormalization to help with classifying types of crossReferences, distinguishing DOIs from PMC ids, etc. pubmed last modified date - The date the meta data on this object was last updated at PUBMED. reference➞pubmed last modified date related to - A relationship that is asserted between two named things from_species - holds between a genomic entity and a species has assembly - holds between a genomic entity and an assembly has feature - holds between a named thing and a feature has gene - holds between a named thing and a gene has genomic location - holds between a genomic entity and a genomic location has go term - holds between a named thing and a gene ontology term has identifier - holds between a named thing and an identifier has note - holds between a named thing and a note has ontology - holds between a named thing and an ontology has publisher reference➞has publisher - Volume of a book or music release in a collection/series or a published collection of journal issues in a serial publication has references - holds between a named thing and a reference has so term - holds between a named thing and a sequence ontology term has synonym - holds between a named thing and a synonym has synonyms has topics - Connects an object to a vocabulary term or ontology that describes some aspect of the entity. reference➞has topics - The list of MeSH terms associated with a reference. Note: this is an association slot that allows a qualifier to be associated with the reference-meshTerm relationship. has transcript - holds between a named thing and a transcript on chromosome - holds between a genomic entity and a chromosome release - MOD release ID title - A human readable title for a reference. reference➞title - the title of the publication type - rdf:type of biolink:Association should be fixed at rdf:Statement association➞type volume volumes Types Built in Bool Decimal ElementIdentifier NCName NodeIdentifier URI URIorCURIE XSDDate XSDDateTime XSDTime float int str Defined BiologicalSequence ( String ) Boolean ( Bool ) - A binary (true or false) value Date ( XSDDate ) - a date (year, month and day) in an idealized calendar Datetime ( XSDDateTime ) - The combination of a date and time Decimal ( Decimal ) - A real number with arbitrary precision that conforms to the xsd:decimal specification Double ( float ) - A real number that conforms to the xsd:double specification Float ( float ) - A real number that conforms to the xsd:float specification Integer ( int ) - An integer Ncname ( NCName ) - Prefix part of CURIE Nodeidentifier ( NodeIdentifier ) - A URI, CURIE or BNODE that represents a node in a model. Objectidentifier ( ElementIdentifier ) - A URI or CURIE that represents an object in the model. String ( str ) - A character string Time ( XSDTime ) - A time object represents a (local) time of day, independent of any particular day Uri ( URI ) - a complete URI Uriorcurie ( URIorCURIE ) - a URI or a CURIE

docs.text: Type: agent_id Different classes of agents have distinct preferred identifiers. For publishers, use the ISBN publisher code. See https://grp.isbn-international.org/ for publisher code lookups. For editors, authors and individual providers, use the individual's ORCID if available; Otherwise, a ScopusID, ResearchID or Google Scholar ID ('GSID') may be used if the author ORCID is unknown. Institutional agents could be identified by an International Standard Name Identifier ('ISNI') code. URI: https://github.com/alliance-genome/agr_persistent_schema/src/schema/reference.yaml/agent_id Domain and Range Agent -> REQ Uriorcurie Parents is_a: id Children Used by Agent
